conversations.content:
I'll be arriving in London on March 15th. Last year, I stayed at the 'London Luxury Hotel', which had amazing reviews and ratings. It was super quiet and clean, and my room had a view of the Thames River. It was such a great experience! This time, I want to try out a new hotel. Once I figure out which one is the best, I'll head there and then find a good restaurant to eat at with my friends.
I have a budget of 160 for the hotel, and I want to stay in a hotel with the highest rating. Can you recommend a hotel? Tell me the name, rating, price range, and address. Thanks a bunch!

<function_thought>
To assist Emma with her hotel request in London within her budget of 160, I will first gather a list of all hotels available in London, then I will filter for prices and ratings to find the best option that fits her requirements. I will start by executing the function to get all hotels in London.
</function_thought>

<function_call>[get_all_hotels_in_city(city="London")]</function_call>

<final_answer></final_answer>

Hotel Names: Cozy Stay
Mom's Home
London Luxury
Covent Garden Retreat
Riverside View

<function_thought>
I've obtained a list of hotels available in London: "Cozy Stay", "Mom's Home", "London Luxury", "Covent Garden Retreat", and "Riverside View". The next step is to get the prices of these hotels to identify those within Emma's budget of 160. 
</function_thought>

<function_call>[get_hotels_prices(hotel_names=["Cozy Stay", "Mom's Home", "London Luxury", "Covent Garden Retreat", "Riverside View"])]</function_call>

<final_answer></final_answer>

<function_thought>

- Mom's Home: 80.0 - 150.0

- Riverside View: 200.0 - 350.0

Since Emma's budget is 160, the hotels "Cozy Stay", "Mom's Home", "London Luxury", and "Covent Garden Retreat" are within her budget. Next, I will gather the ratings and reviews for these hotels to find the one with the highest rating.
</function_thought>
